padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1908131" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Golden96"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324255"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1324255.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Golden96" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1908131ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1908131" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324255">Golden96</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-21">08/21/23 19:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an understated fresh blue denim/suede scent. You’ll want to overspray for sure (5 minimum.) This is one of those fragrances where when someone gets a whiff it’ll draw them in closer to make sure it’s you they’re smelling. Or when you sit down next to someone &amp; you see them take a deep inhale to get a better grasp of the aroma. This is a clean guy who’s not flashy but likes to have fun &amp; take in new experiences. 7.7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1908131"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1908131#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1898379" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1898379" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="linouce"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310887"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1310887.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="linouce" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Interlude-Man-15294.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15294.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Interlude Man"title="Interlude Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1898379ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1898379" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310887">linouce</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-10">08/10/23 01:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Maybe I'm just generally not a big fan of blue fragrances, but I find Luna Rossa Ocean to be extremely boring and uninspired. It's a bit like wearing jeans; not particularly horrible or anything, but so many people wear it that it becomes overdone. You can find better everyday scents IMO, for example Terre d'Hermès.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1898379"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1898379#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1898065" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1898065" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lxaxtxi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791589"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1791589.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lxaxtxi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1898065ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1898065" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791589">lxaxtxi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 14:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its warmth is what makes this frag, for me.<br />
<br />
A nice contrast to its “blue frag” feel.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1898065"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1898065#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1894848" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1894848" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Commander3778"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1685507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1685507.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Commander3778" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Gentlemen-Only-Casual-Chic-29733.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29733.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentlemen Only Casual Chic"title="Gentlemen Only Casual Chic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1894848ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1894848" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1685507">Commander3778</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-05">08/05/23 09:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am extremely disappointed by this, mostly because I really loved the bottle design and that attracts me a lot when it comes to colognes besides their scent. I’am, however, VERY GLAD I did not waste money on a 100ml bottle or worse, a gift box. I just got a sample to test this out and this is my impression:<br />
<br />
-smell is very generic, I do not get the hype but then again I got hyped by the bottle itself<br />
-it does not even last half an hour, sits very VERY close to skin you can barely detect it yourself, I literally catch whiffs of my conditioner more than this cologne after putting it on<br />
-I honestly think there should only be one note on there: aromatic. Because that is all you’ll be catching when you spray this on, the bergamot and maybe pepper? Otherwise, absolutely no depth whatsoever.<br />
<br />
All in all, if you want a night summer scent, that you probably want to last for the rest of the night or at least when you walk out the door, do not get Prada Ocean.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1894848"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1894848#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1893663" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1893663" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BDK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778793"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1778793.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BDK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Gentle-Fluidity-Silver-53400.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53400.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentle Fluidity Silver"title="Gentle Fluidity Silver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1893663ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1893663" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778793">BDK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-03">08/03/23 18:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The longevity complaints I understand, but this fragrance is in no way boring to me. I bought this despite the longevity reviews because this DNA IS AWESOME. Very fresh yet sophisticated. nothing clashes as it’s masterfully blended. Iris and musk behind a fresh curtain of sage and citrus all on that base of caramel (really an undefined sweet note to my nose but I suspect it’s the caramel.) I will say, the clock strikes midnight on this one in a very short time period. I’d say after about 90 minutes this is probably 6 inches of projection on skin that isn’t bone dry, but would still work in intimate situations. I’d say this is extremely versatile, more so than the edp, considering that one is sweeter and more in your face with the caramel imo. I actually prefer the smell of the edt and it would work in all seasons except winter, I imagine this doesn’t project well enough for temps under 50F. If you have travel/decant sprayer bottles this is definitely a good candidate for that application if you want to smell like it for an extended period of time. Usually below average performance turns me away from paying for something that’s hard to find at a discount, but this one smells so damn good i had to get it. <br />
<br />
Smell-8.75/10<br />
Performance-5/10<br />
Versatility-8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1893663"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1893663#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1893272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1893272" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chesterton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1786456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1786456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chesterton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1893272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1893272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1786456">Chesterton</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-03">08/03/23 09:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrus/Bergamot dies almost immediately.  Then we get the Lavender Iris and Vetiver.  This slowly becomes dominated by the sweetness of the caramel.  Not a huge fan of burning from blue to sweet blah.  I can understand that some have been trained to think of sweet as sophisticated and more power too them.  This is just a bland candy caramel sweet and really doesn't bring anything to the table.  It is fortunately not very strong.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1893272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1893272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889046" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amar.dzinic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777806"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="amar.dzinic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777806">amar.dzinic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-28">07/28/23 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely love this scent I got it for a birthday present and was the first cologne that drew me towards cologne collecting. It has a amazing aromatic scent that leads to a flowery scent but still manly. I absolutely love vetiver smells, and usually I hate caramel scents but I'm in love with this. Its so well blended I feel like it smells better than some niche fragrances just doesn't have the longevity and sillage most niche fragrances have, the bottle is beautiful simple but prada really hit with this fragrance. Its a safe blindbuy for anyone ive never met anyone that hasn't liked it honestly, especially if you love a oceanic flowery smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1889046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1889046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1887176" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1887176" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ozymandias62"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1800708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ozymandias62" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1887176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1887176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1800708">Ozymandias62</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-26">07/26/23 00:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Out of all my scents , Oud for greatness, Dior Sauvage EDP, spice bomb intense, Hermes Terre intense.  Prada Luna Rosa EDT is my favorite.  But its longevity is so disappointing, in just a few hours , it’s a skin scent and then hardly that. So I don’t try to wear it anymore. Well what do you expect for a EDT?, I didn’t know I was buying an EDT at the time, had I knew that …I probably wouldn’t have brought the bottle.     I thought the EDP was going to be great.  But in my opinion, the EDT smells better, and the longevity of the EDP is about the same has the EDT.  Disappointing, think I’ll pass on the EDP…though it gets good reviews online…not many of them are talking about the EDP.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1887176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1887176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880004" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880004" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ay&amp;do"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1791708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ay&amp;do" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880004ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880004" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791708">Ay&amp;do</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-16">07/16/23 08:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Need to refresh every 3 hours, sits close to skin after an hour. Sillage is good for an hour <br />
Generally well smelling fragrence. Clean smooth fresh and citrusy opening  and than musk, artemisia caramel adding richness to the fragrance. iris and pachouly not dominant my advise to you don’t buy parfum version instead of edt version becouse edp version very heavy and not rich and fresh like edt version. Edt is quite good blue kind of frags for summer all need to refresh often</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1880004"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1880004#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1878676" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1878676" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Anabol2336"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1007028"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1007028.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Anabol2336" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Sedley-56273.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56273.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sedley"title="Sedley"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1878676ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1878676" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1007028">Anabol2336</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-14">07/14/23 12:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Once again here is an example of a wonderful smelling fragrance that is cursed with below average performance. Just like La Nuit de L' homme and D&amp;G the One before it. If it even had at least average performance I'd buy another bottle, but at the moment it's lumped in with my La Nuit de L' Homme and D&amp;G the One which are used for close encounters at home and nothing more because basically nobody can even smell it. Such a pity. Oh well maybe we will get lucky and Prada will here our complaints and reformulate this one to be a bit stronger similar to how PDM did with Sedley. That one went from a worthless watered down eau de cologne in 2019 to an aquatic beast by 2021. Let's keep our hopes up. If you want an awesome fragrance from Prada that smells like luxury hotel soap a bit like Prada L' Homme, but far Less flowery and a bit more masculine with well above average performance I highly recommend Prada Amber Pour Homme. I'm using it in 100 degree heat and the thing lasts from morning until I come home at night and shower. Very underated and a true hidden gem.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1878676"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1878676#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1878628" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1739476">sheylaarreguina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-10">07/10/23 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh my freaking god, I'm a woman but had to leave my review. I bought this for my husband. I got him the EDT. This is such a nicely blended aromatic fragrance. I can pick up the lavender and the sage, so invigorating, and the dry down is truly beautiful, sweet, oceanic and very high class. This one actually smells expensive, not niche but expensive. He gets so many compliments with this and on his skin it lasts for hours. You have to have this in your collection if you like to smell clean, fresh, sexy and expensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1875761"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1875761#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1875501" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473556">Theend98</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-10">07/10/23 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Has a classic feel to it but upgraded to todays standard year "blue" fragrance. Buts it same addicting but weak :( the EDP isn't better then the OG even tho its a little bit longer lasting. It misses the mark of why its so addicting (top notes being citris and spice, mid notes having aromatics like the lavander and sage woww and the most important peace iris, base notes musk and vetiver going hand to hand and the touch of sweet caramel) hands down a great blend. Prada plz make a perfume intense.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1875501"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1875501#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1875292" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1875292" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tshahb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tshahb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Journey-Man-25251.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25251.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Journey Man"title="Journey Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1875292ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1875292" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579649">Tshahb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-10">07/10/23 04:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the best of this ilk<br />
<br />
For the price it puts MFK to shame, as if this was packaged in an MFK bottle for 300 euros I'd believe it. However that's more of an indictement of MFK than than high praise of Prada.<br />
<br />
What I like about Prada is they use Ambroxan and Ambrocenide sparingly (take note MFK and Dior).<br />
<br />
A powdery, lavendery blue fragrance that stands out from the rest.<br />
<br />
Also, the iris is strong, so if you like Armani Code Parfum, this is cheaper and better.<br />
<br />
Now I'm into the drydown and the vetiver comes through. This is a very good, complex fragrance with stages, great for the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1875292"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1875292#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1875056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1875056" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whateverwhocares"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757007.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whateverwhocares" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1875056ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1875056" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007">Whateverwhocares</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-09">07/09/23 17:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Typical soapy water cologne with a powerful aromatic and fresh zest that sets it apart. Good, not great.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1875056"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1875056#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1874043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1874043" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Muskyflower"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740743"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Muskyflower" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1874043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1874043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740743">Muskyflower</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-08">07/08/23 08:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very well rounded and smooth scent. Just professional quality blend from Prada. This is a very soapy and fresh scent, Iris lavender bomb- with a slight sweetness from the caramel which rounds out the fragrance. I actually like the caramel note in this.<br />
<br />
 I fell in love with this fragrance from opening to dry down- I loved every second of wearing this! This is one of those fragrances that just made me fall in love with life. Easy to wear. <br />
<br />
But then, I really started to pick up the suede note, ever so discreet in the background. Then I felt as if I had smelled this scent before. It just seemed familiar.<br />
<br />
 When I returned home, I looked at my collection and noticed my bottle of Versace dreamer (2010 reformulation). When I first wore Versace Dreamer, it didn't make me fall in love like PLR ocean. However, I do detect similarities. <br />
<br />
So today I will be giving versace dreamer a wear to see how it makes me feel and to test how similiar the two fragrances really are. <br />
<br />
Will come back and edit after a full wearing. <br />
<br />
Ps. Applied PLR Ocean around noon time- could still smell around 8 pm. Longevity is fine. I applied 4 sprays total- 2 sprays on each arm. I find that I personally go less nose blind if u don't spray my neck, chest and shoulders.<br />
<br />
Edit: very similiar to versace dreamer- not doubt about. However, still worth the buy for several reasons: <br />
1. Longevity is better on Ocean<br />
2. Projection is better on Ocean<br />
3. Iris note is far more beautiful on ocean. <br />
4. Ocean is smoother, better blended, rounder, easier to wear. <br />
5. Caramel note as just a hint of sweetness which I enjoy. <br />
6. Dreamer sits closer to the skin- more sprays required. <br />
7. Overall Prada executed this scent profile better in every way- from scent to performance <br />
<br />
I will pick up a FB Of Prada Luna Rossa Ocean. However, Versace Dreamer will always be in my collection as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1874043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1874043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1871319" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I don’t get much “ocean” but I do get fresh and clean for sure.  The caramel note is faint but that mild sweetness helps round it out. After a few minutes on skin I can go nose blind to it but my son likes to steal it and I can smell it clear as day on him so I think performance might be better than people think.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1017652">Naoto</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-19">06/19/23 03:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just received a sample and I quite like it. It is sweet (as people say "caramel like") with a hint of soapiness, yet not overpowering. It is great for spring and summer on any occasion, but the silage and the projection are a bit weaker as eau de pafume....the buyers should expect this as eau de toilet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1859646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1859646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1856104" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1856104" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rogerant"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479933"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1479933.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rogerant" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1856104ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1856104" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); Prada usually has that clean soapiness this is quite funky in the opening and why us that caramel notes in there. Just not a good blend at all. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1850691" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PeopleTent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1208922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1208922.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PeopleTent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1850691ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1850691" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1208922">PeopleTent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-06">06/06/23 16:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice, caramel, powdery iris, some blue aquaticness for the summer and to top things off, I'm not sneezing from its freshness/slighty soapiness. For causal and job situations,  It's go time for this scent in a good way. <br />
<br />
I had an off and on like and no feelings towards this fragrance ever since it hit retailers eventually making up my mind after several testings. And recently got a bottle. It performs well, kind of sophisticated to my nose and its in a class of own because of the unique notes.<br />
<br />
It's smelling great on me right now and I feel confident with it on. <br />
For example there is a part in a movie where let's say a older relative gave a younger relative some money and told them to get themself something nice a make sure everyone sees it, well, in relation to this fragrance review, I wouldn't mind if everyone smelled this on me. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1850691"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1850691#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1849851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1849851" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Niki778"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765304"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Niki778" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Bleu-de-Chanel-Parfum-49912.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49912.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bleu de Chanel Parfum"title="Bleu de Chanel Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1849851ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1849851" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765304">Niki778</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-05">06/05/23 17:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The fragrance opens with a weird almond-y blast, sort of like Givenchy Pi, but lingers only for a few seconds then dries down to pink pepper and lavender. It opens with a synthetic smell but then rounds off better. To me it’s big on the lavender and iris while the Ocean part of this fragrance is just that small hint of salt you get on the drydown. <br />
<br />
The name doesn’t really do it’s justice but it is quite a safe option for the office or everyday use. All in all, I like it, but don’t blind buy it. If you like Bleu de Chanel with more lavender and iris this would be good for you</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1849851"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1849851#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1846760" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Soapy clean smell that really isn’t captivating.  Reminds of nautica voyage type scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1846332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1846332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1846008" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1846008" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LilJoe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1693498"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LilJoe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Afnan/Highness-III-71861.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71861.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Highness III"title="Highness III"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1846008ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1846008" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1693498">LilJoe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-31">05/31/23 13:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Starts nice and fresh but dries down within an hour into a powdery, floral, generic, feminine scent. I can see how some might consider this unisex, but it is definitely not masculine leading, as it is much too floral to my nose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1846008"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1846008#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1845958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1845958" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NamertBaykus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1536428"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NamertBaykus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1845958ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1845958" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); Nothing ocean about it. Poor longevity and sillage for the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1845958"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1845958#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1844001" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1844001" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dumbplings"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410281"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dumbplings" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1844001ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1844001" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410281">Dumbplings</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-28">05/28/23 23:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How many blue scents exist that are actually powdery? there really isn't that many powdery blue scents. And I don't care what people say about this being generic, unoriginal or whatever because they're wrong. You can't name be even 5 blue scents that are powdery. Regardless of what people say this is different for a blue fragrance and unique and the reason why I care about whether it's powdery or not is because I always match fragrances with clothes and occasions. I want a nice blue powdery scent to match my light baby blue clothes and to wear on certain occasions where you want something a little softer and not as fresh like think of a summer night or a summer date, etc..yes it can be worn during warm weather but this is one of those summer nights or date night during summer fragrances to wear instead of the basic sweet/ambery/vanilla frags people normally wear on dates<br />
<br />
The hate for this is completely unjustified</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1844001"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1844001#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1843320" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1842676"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1842676#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1840789" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1840789" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ViceCity"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1478914"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1478914.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ViceCity" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Abercrombie-Fitch/First-Instinct-37753.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37753.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="First Instinct"title="First Instinct"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1840789ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1840789" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1478914">ViceCity</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-24">05/24/23 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For the first time in my life, I feel disappointed with a Prada product - a brand I was trustworthy enough to blind buy (while being on a day-long visit of Milan, I wished to keep a fragrance as souvenir of my visit there). <br />
<br />
As has been pointed out in a few reviews it has nothing oceanic about it. But that is hardly the worst thing: the biggest let-down is that the opening notes smell like medicine! From that moment the sickening combination of pepper and bergamot never really goes away and the lavender, which is one of my favourite notes in perfumery, is never quite felt.<br />
<br />
It's a totally underwhelming perfume that's barely saved by a half-decent dry-down. For half the price one can buy Azzaro Sport which smells kind of similar IMO and has similarly weakish performance, but while costing half the amount.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1840789"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1840789#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1836430" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1836430" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="monsieur.moustache"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1729574"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1729574.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="monsieur.moustache" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1836430ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1836430" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); Ends with salty wood. Sounds like a hot date, but performance is lacking due to low stamina.<br />
<br />
Scent: 7/10<br />
Performance: 5/10<br />
Overall: 6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="68753"comment_id="1836430"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-68753.html?ccid=1836430#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1836121" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
